creator: vishy@borland.com
text:
If you hand multiple jars to lcp.bat, instead of appending them to classpath 
with ";" separator, it uses the blank separator. 

The fix is to change the line 

set _CLASSPATHCOMPONENT=%_CLASSPATHCOMPONENT% %1

to 

set _CLASSPATHCOMPONENT=%_CLASSPATHCOMPONENT%;%1

creator: sbailliez@apache.org

Fixed in CVS HEAD.
Thanks for the report.

Thanks for the quick fix. 

I do not have my own script. However I ship ant's jars along with 20 other 
jars in my appserver's lib directory. So the default ant.bat behavior of 
adding all the jar files in the lib directory is not good for me. So I changed 
the ant.bat to just include some 3 files out of 20 jars that I ship. This is 
when I discovered the problem with lcp.bat.
creator: vishy@borland.com

text:
I intend to revert this change as it breaks all users of Ant who have ANT_HOME
set to a location with spaces in it. 

If you need three specific jars in your setup you can call lcp.bat three times. 

In reality lcp.bat is not a general purpose classpath management tool - it is an
internal utility of Ant to cope with the limitations of Windows.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
OK, I have reverted the changes to once again use a blank separator. Sorry about
that. 

If you look at the CVS history of lcp.bat you will see that it has only ever
been intended to process a single argument. The use of the blank separator when
processing multiple arguments is deceptive. It looks like a bug but the script
knows that multiple arguments can only arise if the single argument contains
spaces. lcp.bat attempts to reconstruct these into the single argument. It's not
perfect - a path with two spaces will confuse it but it does work for the
majority of cases.
